#1- Repeat red violations observed during inspection demonstrating lack of active managerial control. All persons in charge must demonstrate knowledge of food safety and active managerial control. #4- Food worker observed cracking raw shall egg at grill line without a proper handwashing after. All food workers must do a proper handwashing after handling raw animal product and changing tasks. Corrected during inspection.

#01: During discussed w/ PIC they were unable to correctly identify foodborne illness symptoms, no CFPM certificate. There shall be at least 1 person w/ a Certified Food Protection Manager certificate that can also demonstrate adequate food safety knowledge. Correction: Repeat red violation, compliance schedule needed. Enroll in a Certified Food Protection Manager course within 2 weeks and provide documentation.

#06: Inadequate handwashing facilities, kitchen HW sink out of soap. Handwashing facilities shall be adequately stocked w/ soap and paper towels to ensure adequate handwashing occurs. Correction: PIC stocked HW sink w/ soap, repeat red violation, compliance schedule needed. PIC stated switching soap companies, new company soap does not fit in old dispenser. Provide documentation on what the replacement dispenser will be and when it will be installed within 2 weeks.

#14: Raw shelled eggs stored above RTE foods. Raw animal proteins shall be stored below ready to eat foods and stacked according to cooking temperature. Correction: repeat red violation, compliance schedule needed. Health officer will email sign showing proper storage, post on refrigerator and provide documentation within 2 weeks. PIC moved eggs to bottom shelf.

#21: Various TCS foods above 41F, chopped lettuce on ice @ 47-50F, chopped romaine in prep unit @ 47F, and shrimp @ 43F. All TCS Foods shall be kept cold at or below 41F. Correction: Repeat red violation, compliance schedule needed. Submit temperature logs weekly for 2 weeks to health officer. PIC placed more ice around romaine.

#23: Improper consumer advisory, menu's missing disclaimer & reminder. The food establishment shall inform consumers of the significant increased risk of consuming undercooked animal proteins by placing a disclosure on menu and reminders next to menu items w/ cooked to order animal proteins. Correction: Provide adequate consumer advisory on menus within 2 weeks.

#26: Non compliance w/ valid permit, no written procedure or kit available for Vomit & Diarrhea Plan/kit requirement. All food establishments shall have written procedures for employees to follow when a V&D event occurs to minimize the spread of contamination and exposure. Correction: Create written procedure and obtain kit w/in 2 weeks.

#31: Observed TCS food held longer than 24 hours not adequately date marked. All TCS foods kept longer than 24 hours shall be adequately date marked to ensure foods aren't kept more than 7 days. Correction: Begin utilizing a date marking system.

#34: No sanitizer made at time of inspection. While food prep is occurring, an in-use sanitizer shall be available & used to minimize potential cross contamination. Correction: PIC made sanitizer & verified concentration; 150 ppm chlorine.
